XXXIX. Having in ten days' march accom- plished a distance oi 800 stades along the river bank, Hannibal began the ascent of the Alps, and immediately found himself involved in the most serious dangers. For as long as the Carthaginians were on the plains, the various chiefs of the Allobroges refrained firom attacking them for fear of their cavalry, as well as of the Galatae who were escorting them.
